Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's daughter was excluded from the family class under s. 117(9)(d) of the Regulations
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 117(9)(d)
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claim of misunderstanding the declaration was not accepted
Legal_Provision: s. 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Daughter not examined during sponsor’s permanent residence application
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant’s signed acknowledgment that daughter would not be examined
Application_Error: Applicant claimed misunderstanding despite signing declaration
Application_Factor: Examination of dependent during principal application
Decision_Outcome: Daughter remains excluded from family class
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the IAD's interpretation and application of s. 117(9)(d) reasonable?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: s. 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Cause_of_Refusal: Daughter not examined during sponsor’s immigration process
Evidentiary_Issues: Validity of applicant’s declaration despite signing errors
Credibility_Issues: Applicant’s credibility regarding understanding of declaration
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Non-examination of dependent at time of principal application
Omission_Type: Failure to include and examine daughter during sponsorship
